Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk iscsi-initiator-utils
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: iscsi-initiator-utils bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The iscsi-initiator-utils packages provide the server daemon for the Internet Small Computer System Interface (iSCSI) protocol, as well as the utility programs used to manage it. The iSCSI protocol is a protocol for distributed disk access using SCSI commands sent over Internet Protocol (IP) networks. This update fixes the following bugs: Prior to this update, the iscsiadm(8) man page did not list discovery as a valid value to the "--mode" operator. With this update, discovery has been added to the list of valid "--mode" values in the iscsiadm(8) man page. (BZ#963039) Previously, receiving an unexpected netlink message from the kernel, when the iscsiadm utility was waiting for a discovery login to complete, could cause a NULL pointer dereference. As a consequence, iscsiadm terminated unexpectedly with a segmentation fault, and the iSCSI discovery operation failed to complete. This update adds a guard against the delivery of unexpected netlink events, and iscsiadm now safely ignores these events and continues waiting for the discovery login to complete. (BZ#1040343) A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found. With demand loading of iSCSI transport drivers, these drivers could expose an iSCSI host bus adapter (HBA) to the iSCSI user space tools before device initialization was complete. Consequently, commands sent to the drivers before the device was fully initialized could cause errors in the kernel. The kernel drivers have been modified to safely return an error message, and the iSCSI user space has been updated to recognize when an iSCSI device is not ready and to retry the command. (BZ#1081798) Prior to this update, the iscsi service entered a failed state when it could not log in to one or more of the configured iSCSI target portals. With this update, iscsi has been modified to initiate login requests to configured target portals and to ignore the success or failure of these attempts when setting the service state. (BZ#1111925) Previously, the iscsi systemd services did not fully enable the special systemd remote-fs targets. Consequently, iSCSI sessions could be terminated while the storage accessed through them was still mounted, and file-system errors and corruption could occur. The iSCSI service units have been updated to properly request the remote-fs targets, and the system now shuts down and reboots without file-system errors. (BZ#1126524) Previously, some active iSCSI sessions were under certain circumstances not terminated when the network connection was interrupted during system shutdown. Consequently, the system expected the block device to be functional when the iSCSI session was still active, and the SCSI "SYNCHRONIZE CACHE" command sent to the block device failed. This update modifies the iSCSI service to log out of all sessions at system shutdown, except for the sessions created in early boot to reach the root file system. As a result, the iSCSI sessions are now terminated during shutdown, safely detaching the SCSI devices from the system before the network connection is interrupted. (BZ#1166713) Previously, a packaging problem could cause the iscsiuio socket activation to not be enabled after iscsi-initiator-utils installation. As a consequence, iscsiuio did not start when required, and the bnx2i iSCSI host bus adapters (HBAs) did not work properly. With this update, the problem has been fixed, and iscsiuio activation is enabled after iscsi-initiator-utils installation. (BZ#1180100) Users of iscsi-initiator-utils are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
